column1: Common causes include: - Dehydration from not drinking enough fluids and having vomiting, diarrhea, or fever - Total urinary tract blockage, such as from an enlarged prostate - Medicines such as anticholinergics, diuretics, and some antibiotics Less common causes include: - Blood loss - Severe infection or other medical condition that leads to shock
Your health care provider will perform a physical exam and ask questions such as: - When did the problem started and has it changed over time?
- Have you had vomiting, diarrhea, fever, or other symptoms of illness?
